title: The Algorithm's Last Testament
outcome: Free zone technologists unlock Halden’s private logs, revealing his regret over the BCI and a designed failsafe that triggers system-wide shutdowns when abuses are exposed. In the following weeks, Stenograd transforms as BCI powers down—transit is free, services are unlocked, and power returns to the people. The city forms grassroots councils debating their own future, as the Council’s political grip collapses and citizens take charge of law, resources, and labor with open forums. The city’s dependency on authoritarian automation ends.

events.description: A group of free zone technologists uncovers Halden’s personal system logs detailing a failsafe plan to dismantle BCI in response to proven abuses.
BCI modules begin shutting down across the city. Turnstiles and checkpoints stop responding to compliance scores. Public transport and energy distribution are opened to all.
Grassroots councils hold daily assemblies to coordinate healthcare, food, and job distribution, replacing BCI assignments. Neighborhoods experiment with direct democracy and public debate.
Council meetings are sparsely attended. Council loyalists propose drastic measures but are ignored as most officials quietly resign or join local assemblies.
The city officially dissolves BCI as obsolete. For the first time, Stenograd’s fate is publicly shaped by citizen vote and open negotiation, not hidden data or Council decrees.
